[Notes]

Hooks: a musical idea or short riff, passage, or phrase that catches the ear
of the listener. Some bands have `em, most don't. Austin-based five-piece
Scorpion Child have `em in spades. Whether it's an extended blues jam or a
short slice of bombastic heavy rock The Child lay a hook so tasty everyone
bites. Scorpion Child come from lots of different places, not only
logistically but musically. Their sound heralds back to early 70's kraut and
psych-rock with a modern twist and lists Pentagram, Hairy Chapter and
Lucifer's Friend as influences. They originally formed in 2006 and have
spent the last few years perfecting both their songwriting and stage
presence. Aryn Jonathan Black fronts the outfit with a siren-like voice
reminiscent of a young Robert Plant.
